verses.verse: From there he got up and went to the region of Judea on the far side of Jordan, and the people traveled with him again, and as his customarily did he taught them once more.
And the Pharisees came to him an asked him, "Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife." They were tempting him.
He answered and said to them, "What did Moses command you?"
They replied, "Moses allowed a certificate of divorce and sent her away."
Jesus answered and said to them, "Because of your hard heart he wrote you this command.
"Moreover from the beginning of creation, God made them male and female.
"For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be glued to his wife,
"and those two will be one flesh. So then they are not two anymore but one flesh.
"Therefore what God has joined together, do not let man separate."
In the house his disciples asked him again about this.
He said to them, "Whoever will divorce his wife and marry someone else, commits adultery against her.
"And if a woman divorces her husband and get married to someone else, she commits adultery."
Then they brought young children to him, so he could touch them, but his disciples rebuked those who brought them.
But when Jesus saw this, he was very displeased and said to them, "You allow the little children to come to me, and do not forbid them, for of such is the Kingdom of God.
"Truly I tell you whosoever will not receive the Kingdom of God like a little child will not enter it."
And he picked them up in his arms, put his hands on them, and blessed them.
And as he was going on the road, someone came running and kneeled before him and asked him, "Good master, what should I do, so that I may inherit eternal life?"
Jesus said to him, "Why do you call me good? There is no one good, except for one, that is God.
"You know the commandments, «Do not commit adultery, do not kill, do not steal, do not bear false witness, do not cheat [others], honor your father and mother.»
He answered and said to him, "Master, all these I have carefully kept from my youth."

Then Jesus looking at him closely, loved him, and said to him, "You lack one thing, go your way, sell as much as you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven, then come, take up your cross, and follow me."
And he was sad at this and went away grieved, for he had great possessions.
Jesus looked around and said to his disciples, "How hard it is for those who have riches to enter the Kingdom of God."
The disciples were astonished at his words. But Jesus started again to speak and said to them, "Children, how hard it is for those who trust in riches to enter the Kingdom of God."
It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter the Kingdom of God."
And they were extremely shocked saying among themselves, "Who then can be saved?"
Jesus looking at them said, "With men [this is] impossible but not with God, for with God all things are possible."
Then Peter started saying to him, "Look, we have left everything and followed you."
Jesus answered and said, "Truly I say to you there is no man who has left family, brothers, sisters, father, mother, wife, children, or land for my sake and the gospel's,
but that he will receive a hundredfold now in this time houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and lands along with persecution, and in the world to come, eternal life.
"But many who are first will be last and the last first."

Then on the road going to Jerusalem, Jesus went ahead of them. They were shocked, and as they followed him, they were afraid. Again he took the twelve and started to tell them what things were going to happen to him.
"Look, we are going to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn him to death and will hand him over to the Gentiles.
They will mock him, flog him, spit on him, and kill him, but on the third day, he will rise again."
James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to him saying, "Master, we want you to do something for us, whatever we ask."
And he said to them, "What do you want me to do for you?"
They said to him, "Grant us that we may sit-one on you right hand and the other on you left hand-in your glory."
But Jesus said to them, "You don't know what you are asking. Can you drink the cup that I drink from and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?"
And they said to him, "We can." And Jesus said to them, "You will truly drink from the cup that I drink from, and you will be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with,
but to sit on my right hand and my left hand is not mind to give. They will be given to those for whom it is prepared."
When the ten heard about this, they started to get really disgusted with James and John.
But Jesus called them and said to them, "You know that those who seem to rule over the Gentiles control them, and their great one exercise authority over them.
"But it should not be so among you, but whosoever will be great among you will be your servant.
"Whosoever among you will be the most important will be the servant of all.
"For even the Son of Man did not come to be served but to serve and to give his life a ransom for many."
Then they came to Jericho, and as he left Jericho with his disciples and a large number of people, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat alongside the highway begging.
And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he started shouting, "Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me."
But many ordered him to shut up, but he shouted even more, "Son of David, have mercy on me."
Jesus stopped and commanded to summon him. They summoned the blind man saying to him, "Cheer up, get up, he's calling for you."
And he, throwing off his cloak, got up and came to Jesus.
Jesus started to speak saying to him, "What do you want me to do for you?" The blind man said to him, "Lord, that I can see again."
Jesus said to him, "Go your way; your faith has made you well." Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus on the road.
